msContents.summary: Text excerpted from an official account of proceedings before a strategos regarding the will of a soldier's mother and the soldier's right to receive a portion of his mother's estate

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers; the back is blank
6 and a half lines of writing by a large and clear hand
2 diaeresis are used; space in the line to indicate change of speaker; there is a long paragraphos at the bottom
Date problematical: the original text comes from the first half of the second century according to some stylistic features, but the hand seems later

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 22 (original no. 24) in Bell's inventory

div.ab: After the advocate Didymos the younger had replied that the soldier was not harmed by that which had been read, and that he was not disinherited, but that his individual share had been disposed in accordance with a will which his mother had made, the strategos [said], "The will cannot at all harm the soldier, but he ought to inherit in accordance with the edicts read and introduced by him."
